Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the admission of failure by the Indian Air Force in the Balakot airstrike.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it relies on a doctored and old video that was taken out of context.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the admission by the former Indian Air Marshal Denzil Keelor is genuine and related to the Balakot airstrike, when in fact it was made in the context of the 1962 and 1965 wars.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the admission by Keelor was not about the Balakot airstrike, but about past wars and tactical errors.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video was doctored and taken out of context, making the admission misleading.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting misleading information and not providing a clear and accurate account of the situation.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
